results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Rhonda Small
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.

results.title: Australian war memorial
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Gray
results.brief_description: An overview of the Australian War Memorial in Canberra, the quiet cloisters within it and the pictures, exhibits, dioramas, paintings, models and objects of war which recall the battles fought by Australians. Features the paintings and models which depict the 1915 Anzac landings in Turkey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and John Gray

results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.

results.title: Australian Vietnam Forces National Memorial dedication
results.creator_credit: Kinsie McDonald, ABC-TV (Australia) and Max Donnellan
results.brief_description: This video records the dedication ceremony of the Australian Vietnam forces war memorial, Canberra, in October 1992. The video also contains footage of Australian soldiers in action in the Vietnam conflict, speeches by the Prime Ministers Bob Hawke and Paul Keating, and a tree planting ceremony and speech about the Australian Vietnam Forces Memorial forest comprising a tree for every Australian soldier or civilian who lost their lives during the Vietnam conflict. Commentators include Bruce Webster, Bill Fogarty, Paul Berger and Graham Neil.

results.title: Australian Trams in the Sixties. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Reviewing the sights of Australia’s city streets during the swinging ‘60’s brings back all the memories of those wonderful times. This video features Brisbane’s trams from the mid-sixties up until the closure of the system; Flinders and Collins Streets in Melbourne, where we see tramcars; Ballarat, with its mixture of bogie and four wheel cars; Bendigo, for a variety of types including the single truck Birney trams; and the last route to survive in Adelaide’s once extensive system, the Glenelg line.

results.title: Australian trains and tracks
results.brief_description: Jim Downes presents this program which explores the diversity of Australian tracks and trains in the great era of rail transport following World War Two.

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
results.description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. results.title: Australian Story: Man For All Seasons: Wayne Bennett
results.creator_credit: Vanessa Gorman and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
This is Wayne Bennett’s story, a story of successes and failures, family, good times, challenging times, but most of all, about his passion for the Brisbane Broncos and helping them win more Grand Finals in his 20 years of coaching than any other club in Australian rugby league history. Introduced by Caroline Jones.
Broadcast on ABC TV on 6 May 1999. Reporters/producers include Ben Cheshire, Carolyn Davies, Brigid Donovan, Helen Grasswill, John Millard, Wendy Page.

results.title: Australian story
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
From the ABC television series “Australian Story” comes this compilation of five moving portraits of five very different Australians. Common to all five though is that they are battlers in their own way, overcoming adversity and hardship to live life as best they can. “The Big ‘A’” is about former Prime Minister’s wife Hazel Hawke speaking about her struggle with Alzheimer’s disease. “A Man for all seasons” is the story of revered rugby coach Wayne Bennett. “Boots and all” is about the discovery of a wonderful opera singer in a local shoe-repair shop - Peter Brocklehurst. “About a boy” is the story of young cricket enthusiast Dan Halloran, who grew up with his mother having a mental illness. “On the mountain top” is about Victoria Friend and her survival of a plane crash in remote country Australia.
